intro: Microstylis kobi, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. The plant typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and wetlands. Its leaves are narrow and often have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. Microstylis kobi is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in aquatic environments.
